intro: Bernardia mazatlana, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are usually blue or violet in color. Bernardia mazatlana is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats.
